movies.title: Solo for Sparrow
movies.plot: A group of crooks accidentally kill an elderly shop assistant while stealing the keys to the jewelry shop where she works.
movies.simplePlot: A group of crooks accidentally kill an elderly shop assistant while stealing the keys to the jewelry shop where she works.

biography.bio: Yvonne Buckingham was born in 1937 in Yorkshire, England. She is an actress, known for The Christine Keeler Story (1963), Our Man in Havana (1959) and Sapphire (1959).
biography.name: Yvonne Buckingham

biography.bio: Michael Caine was born Maurice Joseph Micklewhite in London, to Ellen Frances Marie (Burchell), a charlady, and Maurice Joseph Micklewhite, a fish-market porter. He left school at 15 and took a series of working-class jobs before joining the British army and serving in Korea during the Korean War, where he saw combat. Upon his return to England he gravitated toward the theater and got a job as an assistant stage manager. He adopted the name of Caine on the advice of his agent, taking it from a marquee that advertised The Caine Mutiny (1954). In the years that followed he worked in more than 100 television dramas, with repertory companies throughout England and eventually in the stage hit, "The Long and the Short and the Tall." Zulu (1964), the 1964 epic retelling of a historic 19th-century battle in South Africa between British soldiers and Zulu warriors, brought Caine to international attention. Instead of being typecast as a low-ranking Cockney soldier, he played a snobbish, aristocratic officer. Although "Zulu" was a major success, it was the role of Harry Palmer in The Ipcress File (1965) and the title role in Alfie (1966) that made Caine a star of the first magnitude. He epitomized the new breed of actor in mid-'60s England, the working-class bloke with glasses and a down-home accent. However, after initially starring in some excellent films, particularly in the 1960s, including Gambit (1966), Funeral in Berlin (1966), Play Dirty (1969), Battle of Britain (1969), Too Late the Hero (1970), The Last Valley (1971) and especially Get Carter (1971), he seemed to take on roles in below-average films, simply for the money he could by then command. There were some gems amongst the dross, however. He gave a magnificent performance opposite Sean Connery in The Man Who Would Be King (1975) and turned in a solid one as a German colonel in The Eagle Has Landed (1976). Educating Rita (1983) and Hannah and Her Sisters (1986) (for which he won his first Oscar) were highlights of the 1980s, while more recently Little Voice (1998), The Cider House Rules (1999) (his second Oscar) and Last Orders (2001) have been widely acclaimed.
biography.name: Michael Caine

biography.bio: Michael Coles was born on August 12, 1936 in London, England as Ernest Michael Coles. He was an actor, known for The Satanic Rites of Dracula (1973), Dracula A.D. 1972 (1972) and Dr. Who and the Daleks (1965). He was married to Maryon Kantaroff. He died on April 26, 2005 in Chelsea, England.
biography.name: Michael Coles

biography.bio: Cuthbertson arrived in Britain in 1947, and appeared shortly thereafter as Romeo in Romeo and Juliet at the Boltons. In London's West End, he appeared as Laertes in Hamlet, Aimwell in The Beaux Stratagem, and Octavius Robinson in Man & Superman, among many other roles.
biography.name: Allan Cuthbertson

biography.bio: Eric Dodson was born on December 1, 1920 in Peterborough, England as Eric Norman Dodson. He was an actor, known for The Mirror Crack'd (1980), Trial and Error (1962) and Crossroads (1964). He was married to Rosaline Haddon and Pearl Dadswell. He died on January 13, 2000 in Cheltenham, Gloucestershire, England.
biography.name: Eric Dodson

biography.bio: William Gaunt was born on April 3, 1937 in Pudsey, Yorkshire, England as William Charles Anthony Gaunt. He is an actor, known for Sergeant Cork (1963), No Place Like Home (1983) and The Champions (1968). He has been married to Carolyn Lyster since September 7, 1974. They have two children.
biography.name: William Gaunt

biography.bio: Glyn Houston was born on October 25, 1925 in Tonypandy, Glamorgan, Wales as Glyndwr Desmond Houston. He is an actor, known for Keep It in the Family (1980), The Cruel Sea (1953) and The Long Chase (1972). He has been married to Shirley Lawrence since 1956. They have two children.
biography.name: Glyn Houston

biography.bio: Susan Maryott was born on March 20, 1933 in Hampstead, London, England as Susan Mary Schlesinger. She was an actress, known for Brothers in Law (1957), Jo's Boys (1959) and The Diary of Samuel Pepys (1958). She died on July 18, 1963 in Chelsea, London.
biography.name: Susan Maryott

biography.bio: Jack May was born on April 23, 1922 in Henley-on-Thames, Oxfordshire, England. He was an actor, known for The Man Who Would Be King (1975), Count Duckula (1988) and Adam Adamant Lives! (1966). He was married to Petra Davies. He died on September 19, 1997 in Hove, East Sussex, England.
biography.name: Jack May

biography.bio: Neil McCarthy was born on July 26, 1932 in Lincoln, Lincolnshire, England as Eugene Neil McCarthy. He was an actor, known for Where Eagles Dare (1968), Zulu (1964) and Clash of the Titans (1981). He died on February 6, 1985 in Fordingbridge, Hampshire, England.
biography.name: Neil McCarthy

biography.bio: Murray Melvin was born on August 10, 1932 in St. Pancras, London, England. He is an actor, known for Barry Lyndon (1975), The Phantom of the Opera (2004) and A Taste of Honey (1961).
biography.name: Murray Melvin

biography.bio: Bartlett Mullins was born on August 13, 1904 in Crosby, Lancashire, England as William Bartley Mullins. He was an actor, known for Sex and the Other Woman (1972), Frankenstein Created Woman (1967) and Gone to Earth (1950). He died on May 15, 1992 in Devon, England.
biography.name: Bartlett Mullins

biography.bio: Anthony Newlands was born on January 31, 1925 in Edmonton, London, England as Raymond Gordon Newland. He was an actor, known for Room at the Top (1959), Psycho-Circus (1966) and Hysteria (1965). He died on October 6, 1995 in Camden, London.
biography.name: Anthony Newlands

biography.placeOfBirth: Glebe, Sydney, New South Wales, Australia
biography.bio: Nancy O'Neil was born on August 25, 1907 in Glebe, Sydney, New South Wales, Australia as Nancy Muriel Smith. She was an actress, known for Something Always Happens (1934), The Secret of the Loch (1934) and Jack Ahoy (1934). She died on March 5, 1995 in Fulham, London, England.
biography.name: Nancy O'Neil

biography.bio: Nadja Regin was born on December 2, 1931 in Nis, Serbia, Yugoslavia as Nadezda Poderegin. She is an actress, known for Goldfinger (1964), From Russia with Love (1963) and Esalon doktora M. (1955).
biography.name: Nadja Regin

filmingLocations.location: Merton Park Studios, Merton, London, England, UK
